summary: The 'Healing Partnerships for Survivors Act' amends the Family Violence Prevention and Services Act to authorize grants for strengthening relationships between healthcare providers and community-based sexual assault programs. The grants aim to support survivors of sexual assault across their lifespan by funding trauma-informed services, training, and partnerships. The bill also includes provisions for technical assistance and training for grantees, and authorizes $30 million annually for fiscal years 2026-2030 to fund these initiatives.
